intro: Cyathogyne spathulifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf cyathogyne, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory species in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features include thick, waxy leaves that help retain moisture in its native habitat. Cyathogyne spathulifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
